timeline.message:
Update quickstart-java.md

I don't think we actually want to use the pom.xml as the `inputFile` for the direct runner. You can use the Shakespeare sample, just like with the other runners.
added sample text file for use with Java DirectRunner examples

timeline.bodyText: I think we should hold off updating the website until a beam release has gone out with the change to add the sample file. The website is published regularly, so if we update it now the quickstart will start telling users to do this with 2.25 and it won't work.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -283,7 +283,7 @@ We are working on adding the instruction for this runner!
 
 {{< highlight class="runner-spark" >}}
 $ gradle clean execute -DmainClass=org.apache.beam.examples.WordCount \
-    -Dexec.args="--inputFile=pom.xml --output=counts" -Pspark-runner
+    -Dexec.args="--inputFile=sample.txt --output=counts" -Pspark-runner

replies.bodyText: Ah, I didn't know that. Okay, I updated --inputFile to follow the Python model, so it points to /path/to/inputfile. I still think that makes a lot more sense than using the pom as input.
replies.author: pcoet

replies.bodyText: I originally left the license off on purpose. It seems like other Apache projects mostly leave the license off of example data, e.g. apache/spark/blob/master/examples/src/main/resources/kv1.txt. How would I add the sample to the allow list?
replies.author: pcoet

replies.bodyText:
If we are switching to use --inputFile=/path/to/inputfile. I guess we can remove the sample completely.
If you woud like to add an exception you can add a line (https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/build.gradle#L42) pointing to the sample file.
replies.author: aaltay
